intro: Taraxacum oinopopodum, commonly known as the meadow dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flower heads that develop into fluffy white seeds, typical of the dandelion genus. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and are covered with fine hairs. Taraxacum oinopopodum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
